intro: Phyllocyclus minutiflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered phyllocyclus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hair. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
